entry.title: Terrible Implementations of Is Even
entry.content:
I stumbled on this written as a joke somewhere on the web and found it hilariously terrible. What a way to turn a O(1) modulus operation into the glorious abomination you see here. This algorithm has a runtime of O(2n).

def is_even(num):
  x = abs(num)
  # x is even if it can be divided into two parts y and z that equal each other
  y,z = 0,0
  # take turns incrementing y and z
  for i in range(x):
    if is_even(i):
      y += 1
    else:
      z += 1
  return (y == z)

Runtime(x) = Runtime(x-1) + Runtime(x-2) + ... + Runtime(0)  
Runtime(x-1) = Runtime(x-2) + Runtime(x-3) + ... + Runtime(0)  
Runtime(x) = 2 * Runtime(x-1) = 2 * 2 * Runtime(x-2) = ... = 2 * 2 * 2 * ... * Runtime(0) = 2^x * const.
entry.summary: I stumbled on this written as a joke somewhere on the web and found it hilariously terrible. What a way to turn a O(1) modulus operation into the glorious abomination you see here. This algorithm has a runtime of O(2n).

entry.title: This mofo is real!
entry.content:
This is the latest iteration of this blog, after approx a million iterations over many years. I have more fun making the blog than actually posting to it.

Not much else to say other than this time around everyting is raw css, html, and whatnot for the design and layout and Jekyll to generate all the static files.


Learnings/Impressions

  • CSSâ€¦why?
  • Why does an image have to be set to display:block to not have a margin at the bottom?
  • Why is margin-left:1rem; not the default for list items and why is list-style-position: inside almost there except that on the newline the text flows under the bullet.
  • So many more CSS questions.
  • On the bright side: Flexbox is awesome.
  • Using rem units is awesome.
  • I wish there was a debug tool that you could turn on in the browser to add 1px borders to some/all elements.
  • position:fixed with a div spacer of the same height underneath is a cool way to make a sticky nav bar.
  • I made a side bar but not sure what to do with it yet.
entry.summary: This is the latest iteration of this blog, after approx a million iterations over many years. I have more fun making the blog than actually posting to it.
